scenario:
A new Cogent Syndicated report from Escalent finds that business customer engagement with utilities has improved significantly, ending a trending decline that began at the end of 2021. The Engaged Customer Relationship (ECR) score, which measures business customer engagement, has recovered to 784 in 2024 from a low of 766 in 2023. The score is still below its peak of 793 in mid-2021 but is significantly higher than pre-pandemic levels.

The report attributes the improvement in business customer engagement to a significant Brand Trust gain, particularly in utility company reputation and business community support. Utilities that develop focused programs, customer service options, and communication for small and midsize business customers see higher engagement scores.

Escalent has named 24 utilities as its 2024 Business Customer Champions, which outperform the industry in metrics such as helping customers save money and energy, and billing and payment processes. These utilities include AEP Ohio, Duke Energy Florida, and Xcel Energy - Midwest.

The report also highlights regional differences in customer engagement, with utilities in the East Region, such as National Grid and BGE, performing well, while those in the West Region, such as PG&E and SDG&E, lag behind.

Duke Energy is one of the utilities named as a Business Customer Champion, with a regional peer benchmark Engaged Customer Relationship score of 809 in the Midwest Region.
